data.text: Then Eliphaz replied,
“◄Can anyone be useful to God?/Certainly no one can be useful to God.► [RHQ]
If you were righteous, ◄would that benefit Almighty God?/that certainly would not benefit Almighty God.► [RHQ]
“Is it because you have an awesome respect for God that he punishes you?
No, it certainly must be [RHQ] because you are extremely wicked.
You must have lent money to others and wrongly forced them to give you things to guarantee that they would pay that money back to you;
You must not have given water to those who were thirsty,
Because you were very powerful, you must have taken over all the people’s land,
When widows came to you for help, you must have sent them away without giving them anything,
Because of all that, now there are pits around you for you to fall into,
It is as though it has become very dark, with the result that you cannot see anything,
“But consider this, Job: God lives [RHQ] high up in the heavens.
So why do you say, ‘What does God know about what we are doing?
Do you think that while he walks on the dome that covers the sky,
Will you continue to conduct your life the old way
They suddenly died while they were still young;
They kept saying to God, ‘Do not bother us,’
But it was God who filled their houses with good things,
“But when God punishes wicked people, and righteous people see that, they are glad,
They say, ‘Now our enemies have been destroyed,
“So, Job, be reconciled to God and make peace with him;
Allow him to teach you,
If you humble yourself and return to God,
if you throw away your gold,
and if you allow Almighty God to be as precious to you as your gold and your silver have been,
you will be happy because of your close relationship with God,
You will pray to him, and he will do what you request him to do;
Everything that you decide to do will be successful;
God humbles those who are proud,
God rescues those who ◄are innocent/have not done things that are wrong►,
